Reviews.Title: “Budget Hotel – You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: pateshko
Reviews.Content: We booked this budget hotel for a trip to Rome because of its extremely convenient location to the train station. The location didn’t disappoint at all. From there we were able to hop on trains and various buses. There were also many restaurants to choose from around the train station for cheap eats. Being a budget hotel, I was not surprised that there was no Jacuzzi tub in the bathroom – you get what you pay for. I was satisfied with the quality of the rooms based on the price and included breakfast every morning.

Reviews.Title: “Lol”
Reviews.Author: Paul D
Reviews.Content: Oh my god what a mess. Could not believe the state of this so called hotel. If you want to just use it for sleeping in only, do it. Three of us arrived and couldn't believe what we had come to. It's a large building with about 4 other hotels all in the same building. To keep this short , it's a mess in a decorative way. We made do because we had no other option and we had a brill time in Rome. I won't slag the hotel off to much because at the end of the day we went on a budget ,so got what we paid for. They didn't have any safety boxes for us to leave valuables in so took the chance of leaving money and gear in the room when we went out. Beds made when we came back and everything in its place. GO , but seriously dont expect to much. To sum up , disappointed on arrival, in good location, nice places to eat very close by. Would stay there again though , it was a laugh , and like I say , you get what you pay for. Wish everyone there all the best who ever they are.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best obviously.....”
Reviews.Author: Janetix86
Reviews.Content: Where to start....the seedy character at the front desk, the dodgy and dirty bathrooms or the complete lack of security? I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone really, but especially if you are in a group of ladies. We hardly slept a wink thinking we would have to Liam Neeson an intruders behind. Not a good feeling at all. Thankfully we only stayed one night. These guys literally need to clean their act up. Eww.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: cath353
Reviews.Content: We were placed in this hotel when our initial hotel did not have our reservation secured. Trying to make the best of a bad situation I entered this hotel with an open mind. Unfortunately this was just the continuation of my nightmare, The hotel was very old and not well kept in the slightest, the toilet was broken, there was wires hanging out of the walls and the shower was flithy. At this stage all I wanted was just a good nights sleep and to start fresh in the morning... this however was made impossible by the camp style beds, it felt like sleeping on a mat on the floor. I imagine this is what 1 room shacks must look like after they have been abandoned. We decided the next morning that we would look for another hotel after breakfast (which we had paid for but did not receive). The bright side of this hotel however is its location we were ten mins away from a train station and in the city so we had some nice bars and restaurants around us. When we returned to our hotel that evening to check out and retrieve our bags we were HORRIFIED that there were guests already settling into our room before we had even checked out. Our bags and personal belongings including passports could have been damaged or stolen, and the hotel did not so much as apologise. Unprofessional is too light of a word to use. This is a safety issue and I would not recommend this hotel to my worst enemy.

Reviews.Title: “GROSS”
Reviews.Author: Brent K
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the 15 & 16th days of our European Tour Covering 4 countries and 6 different cities. We tried to pick moderate / mid range 3 star hotels, knowing we were not in the room except to sleep. This hotel does not come close to anything else we stayed in during the entire duration of our trip. It was horrific, dirty, run down, dark (no lights in hallways), smelled,etc... Shower door was broke then glued back together , mold in shower, bathroom mirror was broke, hair dryer was covered with black tape, big hole in ceiling where they had to gain access to put in new AC unit, the list could go on and on... I am not one to complain about a hotel and have never done so or taken my time to write a review on a hotel in my LIFE. But this place was absolutley TERRIBLE.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location!”
Reviews.Author: shippers23
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located, just a short walk from Termini station and within easy reach of attractions, restaurants, shops and bars. The staff were polite, helpful and knowledgeable about Rome and its attractions. The rooms were clean, tidy and air conditioned making the stay very relaxing and comfortable. Breakfast was a coffee/ tea/ juice and an Italian pastry. Rooms were cleaned to a very good standard every day.

Reviews.Title: “An Awful Place and not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Greenbooks
Reviews.Content: We were booked into another place but due to plumbing problems they sent us here. We had prepaid the other place and they worked some deal to pay this place. The two young guys at the front desk were not professional, just a couple Morroccan guys more interested in talking to each other than in guests. This "hotel" is a collection of rooms on various floors of a building housing other small hotels and apartments. The first room we got was dingy, and dirty with wafer thin mattresses. The whole place was really worn out. There was no air conditioning and no towels. We went down and told the guys we had paid for an aircon room at the other place, After some hemming and hawing they gave us keys to another room, this time with air conditioning. It was still a little grubby, wafer thin mattresses, worn-looking old bed spreads and furniture and no towels. I hopped into the shower not realizing there were no towels. My wife went down to get some but the young guy in the lobby, now alone, said he could not leave his post to get towels. I had to dry off with my clothes. After that I went down stairs to try to get towels. The front desk was empty and the guy was out in the street jawing away with his friend. So much for not leaving the post. We went out for dinner, found another place, returned and took our bags and left to a real hotel, same amount of stars, 10 Euros more, and a thousand times better. This place is a ripoff for the 90 Euros they charge per night. I would only recommend this as a last resort or if its price was commensurate with what they offer. At best this is a 30 Euro per night, (for a double) one star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Horrendous... Do not make this mistake”
Reviews.Author: ExpeditiousDMC
Reviews.Content: The hotel is barely a 2 star while they claim it's a 3. The rooms have a bad odor, broken beds, dirty linen and missing bare necessities like towels. Hotel Staff likes to "Blame Game" for everything. AVOID THIS HOTEL

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE!!!”
Reviews.Author: PutnikCG
Reviews.Content: Do not believe photos on the internet. I know that there are good hotels that some people like some doesn't , but this one is horrible. It was soooooo dirty and looked suspicious and unsafe. We booked it for 8 nights, and couldn't stay a minute. We spent three hours looking for another hotel, and we managed to find it. It is funny that this hotel has 3 stars, when you can find nice hotels with the same category nearby. Please, take my friendly advise, go away from this place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money!”
Reviews.Author: hollyGolightly24
Reviews.Content: Well located 2 mins from Castle Pretorio Metro and 7 mins from Termini. Room clean, Staff very friendly, breakfast typically Italian coffee, juice and pastry. Couldn't find fault. If you like towelling towels take your own, the hotel ones are cotton, like most Italian hotels, but they dry you very well and are changed every day. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to see the sights of Rome without paying over the odds for a room you will rarely see!

Reviews.Title: “Below our expectations”
Reviews.Author: msamaha8
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at Tre Stelle hotel after a long flight to Rome, we were definitely disappointed with the arrangements. The hotel didn't look nearly as nice as the pictures on their website. Our room was very small (the bed took up most of the room) and the window view overlooked a broken down alley. Every door that was shut in other guest rooms would echo loudly through the building, making it hard to sleep at night. On the bright side, the room was cleaned everyday by friendly staff and the price was pretty decent. Also, the hotel is only a few blocks from the bus/train terminal so we were able to get around Rome very easily from here. I'd recommend only using this hotel if you're willing to put up with these conditions for the reduced price. I will seek a different hotel when I return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel for this price!!!”
Reviews.Author: SonjaS85
Reviews.Content: This is really good hotel for this price and it is cheap!!! The staff was friendly and helpfull and it was clean (which is the most important for me). The location was very good! Before my trip, I read some comments and I was a little bit suspicious and scared, but when I arrived I was pleasantly surprised! The only bed thing was window that we couldn't open and we didn't have day light. It didn't bother us because the air condition was working all the time and we were all day outside sightseeing Rome. I would really recommend it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for this price”
Reviews.Author: esbaba
Reviews.Content: For the price we had to pay, this was realy a good hotel! The room and bathroom where clean, the beds maybe a little bit to hard if you're not used to that. The staff was very friendly, breakfast was oké. I realy don't understand all the complains, when you don't want to pay a lot of money for a hotel, than is this the right place to go to. If you want more luxery you have to pay more. Television with only one chanel? No internet? I think you come over to Rome to see the beautiful city, why do you need television??? If I go back to Rome, I will stay in this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: WesAustralia
Reviews.Content: Welcome to Rome, unless your staying at Tre Stella... Our "3 star" room offered delightful views of garbage, broken aircons and an alley that would scare off the most hardened gypsy. Towel's as thin as a bed sheet, broken cistern and more mould than Ive ever seen. To use the shower we had to disinfect and scrub it first. Not to mention the smell, the rotten sewage smell, it was suffocating to say the least... As they say, "When in Rome........dont stay at Tre Stella"

Reviews.Title: “God Awful! Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: strux
Reviews.Content: This is the first negative review I have ever written on Trip Advisor. The hotel Tre Stelle was horrible. First of all, it was filthy. There was so much mildew and mold in the shower that it was disgusting. The lighting was terrible too--with all of the lights turned on it was still so dim that you couldn't even read a book. The TV only got one channel, even though they say they have satellite. The beds were thin, springy mattresses that were glorified cots. The man at reception was not helpful at all. There was no internet, even though they advertised that they had it. However, the most disturbing thing was that there was absolutely no security. Someone could easily walk in off the street and get to the rooms. They take your passports, which are kept in cubbies in plain view of anyone. It would be so easy to steal them! Overall, the only good points to the Hotel Tre Stelle were location -- right next to a subway stop and 5 blocks from Termini train station and the friendly women in the breakfast room.

Reviews.Title: “Do not believe there web site pictures!”
Reviews.Author: 3starsstinks
Reviews.Content: There is a Best Western in the same building just around the corner, for about the same price it is really nice. This hotels web site show nice rooms, but when you get there they are dumps, the funiture is all chipped and broken. Do not believe the web site photos. The bathroom smelled like a sewer. I asked them to fix it, they said they would, but did nothing about it. Do not use this hotel. Do not pre pay!

Reviews.Title: “A good place for the offered money”
Reviews.Author: kkamal
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly. The room was clean and the bath as well. Shower made for sportsmen and we did not had problems with. Breakfast was simple but enough to start the day. The hotel was 7-8 minutes from Termini railway station and we could walk to the Colosseum in about 20-25 minutes and walk to other main locations in the town. There is a bus and metro station near Termini which can be used to visit the Vatican. It was nice to stay at the Tre Stelle hotel. A good place for the offered money. Thank you Tre Stella.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid like the plague”
Reviews.Author: ruairi7
Reviews.Content: Firstly I should state that I did not actually stay at Hotel Saturnia. My room was booked with Hotel Saturnia, but when we got there we were told that they were overbooked and they had arranged a room in another hotel, Hotel Tre Stelle. The hotel was 1.5km away and no taxi was offered even when we asked. The alternative was disgusting. The first room we were shown to, smelled like human excrement. No mistaking that smell. And not just a whiff of it either. Full-on smell with flavour. Also, I pulled the sheets back and there was what appeared to be dried blood on the bed. I complained (in Italian) and the reception guy laughed. Ha ha!! We were shown to a different room which was sufficient. Slightly damp and horrible decor with jaded mattresses. I called Hotel Saturnia to complain and when I identified myself, the guy on the phone said in Italian: "oh yeah, the guy from the room which smells like [--]! Ha ha". No chance of refund or a second alternative hotel. It was late and we had to meet people so we had to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely hopeless. Don't waste your money here.”
Reviews.Author: ausgirl_britboy
Reviews.Content: Extremely disappointed in the hotel. Had to repeatedly ask for basics such as toilet paper and towels. The breakfast consisted of one stale pastry and one cup of coffee. THERE IS NO PARKING despite what the website and staff will tell you. Their interpretation of 'in hotel - garage upon request' (as per their website) just means they will point out the parking metre on the street for you. The room was tiny and felt unclean. There were obvious stains on the curtains and blankets. The manageress is completely dismissive of any complaints or difficulties you may be having, and tends to just reply with something along the lines of 'I've worked here for 9 years and this has never been a problem'. Worst hotel I've ever stayed in. You can do much better with your money.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic. Can stay. But can find better for the money”
Reviews.Author: ShubiDubi
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very very basic. I wouldn't say it's a dump, but there are a lot of annoying things: The walls needs repainting, and the light was too low (hard to read our traveling guide at night in the room). The breakfast is very poor: Only one cup of coffee and one croissant. that's it. the elevator is very small and you still have about 10 stairs to carry on. The hotel is 10 minutes from termini, but you do have a metro station 1 minute from the hotel (1 stop from termini) Regarding the towels - they were napkin-thin, I agree, but we find it odd, not annoying. They did take out passports but just for 2 minutes to write down our details and then returned it back - don't see anything wrong about it. Also they gave us the remote controls when we got the room - again: odd but not annoying. We must say the room was clean, we got fresh new (thin) towels every day, and the stuff were friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend this Hotel to anyone”
Reviews.Author: Molton
Reviews.Content: we arrived at the hotel after midnight by taxi and were checked in and directed to a very small lift which the 3 of us could not fit in together with our luggage. The lift took us to the 4th floor we had to then heave our cases us the next 2 flights of stairs to the room. The room I can only describe looked like a hostel - we have stayed in hostels before and I dont mind if i have paid for a hostel but not for a hotel. the curtains were hanging of the rail - the air conditioning was non existent - the beds were clean - but the room was dingy and tired - the bathroom towels were like tea towels - when you flushed the toilet the water from the cistern on the wall spat out over the top and onto you. We hardly slept the night - and my husband told them we were checking out the next day - they showed us 2 other rooms - one which was bigger than our and the other similar to ours - but we could not stay there another night - we moved to a hotel around the corner which was only 4 months opened - for another £29 extra per night - it was like night and day and the breakfast was a full continental breakfast with orange juice, cheeses, eggs, fruit etc., and 10 times nicer than staying in the middle of a building site.

Reviews.Title: “not a bad hotel at all”
Reviews.Author: xxcaramacxx
Reviews.Content: having read some of the bad reviews on here i was a bit worried about staying, however we had a good experience in this hotel. The hotel was easy enough to find and very close to termini station, yes they do take your passports at the reception but this is because they have to register your details. The room and bathroom weren't huge but it was clean and comfortable. We did have to ask for the remote for the air con but it worked fine. Breakfast is typical continental, a pastry and coffee/hot chocolate etc and if you want toast as well. The hotel was in a great location and we found that most places were within walking distance however there are many buses that run into the centre from termini. There are also lots of restaurants at the back of the hotel, a small supermarket opposite which was useful and an internet access shop at the end of the road. yes it is no frills, but its a comfortable base for sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Made my trip to rome”
Reviews.Author: dayzi630
Reviews.Content: oK, Tre Stelle is what you paid for. Yes the room was small but the bed was big and it had a TV, hair dryer, closet and bathroom. We are a young couple who can't afford much but it was just what we needed. We were able to walk everywhere from where we stayed (although we walked a lot and this isn't for families with little kids or elder folks). If walking isn't ok, there is a metro station 2 minutes away. If you aren't looking to be wowed or to spend much more time than showering and sleeping in your room this is great. The breakfast was good and what was best was the young guy at the front desk. He was so nice and helped us with whatever we needed. I was a bit cold and he even offered us his space heater from the office but an extra blanket was all we needed. Also, although the towels were a kind of cloth napkin material they were clean as was the room every day. We had enough shampoo and soap and toilet paper. No offense to europe but this is much more than you usually get in any country besides the US. Its a three star so its no Hilton but it does the job and although we didn't love rome, we'd stay in this hotel again. Finally, the pictures are a bit misleading. The tables in the cafe don't look that nice but that is the cafe and the beds never had flowers or wine laid out on them. But hey, most adds spice up their product why expect anything less.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay”
Reviews.Author: Europe08Australia
Reviews.Content: advise anyone do not stay here! luckily we had read the reviews on trip advisor as there was a couple hotels in the same building bit confusing. once we arrived we walked down the hallway to our room, there was dirty mattress, towels and sheets everywhere, then we open our room up and instant reaction was this was a room not fit to sleep in. the bed when we sat just about hit the floor, and with a large twang of the springs, the pillows were flat and couldnt even tell they were there. the cracks in the wall were a concern so many of them worried the hotel might collapse, the lights were dim couldnt see anything. went to turn the tv on and no remote, had to pick it up from reception. also very noisy with motorobikes and cars kept us awake. we went out to dinner and didnt want to return back there. should be a 1 star hotel....breakfast was pretty crappy too but thankfully we werent that hungry.

Reviews.Title: “Bug infested dump”
Reviews.Author: kjf7658
Reviews.Content: What a dump, small room, very noisy, and not much light in the room. To my surprise I get up in the middle of the night and to my surprise when I open the light in the bathroom we had a few visitors crawling around the sink and shower area. I think they were roaches but not quite sure because I had only seen them on tv ads. When I complained they came up with a can of roach killer so I don't think I was the first to complain.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to complain about!”
Reviews.Author: Belba
Reviews.Content: I was pleased with Hotel Tre Stelle. The room was small but tidy, there was nothing wrong with the bathroom, everything worked perfectly! Though I found it a little bit hard to find the Hotel because of the small sign.. The breakfast wasn't great but I didn't expect it to be. The staff was friendly and helpful. If you want a low price hotel near Termini, I warmly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Awful dive!”
Reviews.Author: martingerardkelly
Reviews.Content: Hi, I know you are not accountable for the actual hotels, but my family and I are just back from a nice trip to Rome, almost ruined by staying in this hotel. As I check the internet, I find many similar experiences. If you are able to, you should consider removing this hotel from your website. The room was dark, dingy and noisy++. The bathroom flooded, with horrible faeculent material coming up onto the floor. The smell was nearly unbearable. We had to be asked to move rooms. The staff were not as helpful as you would hope, when you have young kids. The breakfast room was miserable in size, and could not cope with numbers. The photos on the website are very misleading. In fact, I see on another website that they use photos from a DIFFERENT hotel in the same building. Awful place overall! Prob one of the worst places I've ever stayed, and I've stayed in rough places! Martin Kelly

Reviews.Title: “Don't Bother - miserable experience”
Reviews.Author: goodmd1
Reviews.Content: Arrived for a three night break and left this morning. Our friends in an ajacent room wanted to leave immediately they saw their room - if only there was readily available accomodation elsewhere!. They left the next morning! Against my better judgement we soldiered on! Dark and dingy, miserable rooms, lacking reasonable hotel comforts such as decent towels, plug sockets that were securely fixed to the walls, a remote control for the TV. This was truly like a basic hostel rather than a hotel costing 120 euros a night for a double room. I know it's Rome - but still felt ripped off.. First night had a cold shower due to the "pilot" light going out on the boiler. The second evening - same cold shower, but this time the disinterested staff couldn't even be bothered to come up with an excuse. Following morning, a lukewarm shower, presumably because a few other guests got up earlier and beat me to it! Rubbish breakfast of a coffee and pastry - redeemed however by a second coffee provided on request - surprisingly no additional charge, I expect because the suffering staff felt sorry for me. My only recommendation is to avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Can't complain...better than a hostel!”
Reviews.Author: missoni
Reviews.Content: The hotel is within walking distance from Termini Station, however we had a little trouble finding it because of the large Hotel Dolomitti sign. We arrived straight from a flight from Australia at 9am and were greeted warmly and able to check in straight away. Our room was very small and dark and although I certainly wouldn't rave about it, I can't complain because we were grateful to have a centrally located cheap hotel. (There is also another metro station even closer than termini for nights that we were all walked out!) The bathroom was fine, however very old and the shower was tiny. The cappucinos at breakfast were strong but excellent, there is also juice and a choice from over 10 different danishes and croissants.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever!!!! avoid even if its going really cheap!”
Reviews.Author: Rach1971
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in febuary 2005. I had booked a weekend to rome as a surprise for my partners 40th birthday. We were not booked in to stay at this hotel originally but when arriving at the hotel we should have been staying at they had no record of us staying thee so sent us to another hotel. we arrived at the trestelle very tired, confused and worried that we might not have anywhere to stay so was at first just releived that we had somewhere to stay. that soon wore off when we was shown to our rooms. The rooms themselves were grotty, damp and cold. there was no heating on and the air was cold and damp. The view from the window was of all the bins out the back of the hotel. Breakfast was attrocious! Rock hard stale bread, cold coffee from a coffee machine and to go with it ...mould on the walls. the location was good for the termini station but that was the only good thing about it. Rome was fantastic and i have just returned from there again but there is no way on this earth i would ever recommend this hotel to anyone...ever! Stay at the viminale hotel! we had a great time and a lovely hotel room to return to in the evenings.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel of our lifes”
Reviews.Author: reefdolphin
Reviews.Content: We booked through Universe Travel located in Toronto, and had the worst experience ever at this hotel. The room that we got was way below any standards. With iron beds that looked like they belong in the concentration camp & blankets that were old & had holes in them, the towels were in terrible condition. In addition to that the lamps beside the bed were broken, the wallpaper torn & the rooms and bathroom were teaming with cockroaches. We killed several of the cockroaches and took them to the receptionist, but they were not surprised at all and showed little emotion, like it was “part of the package”. We asked to change the room, but it was almost the same quality with even more cockroaches & ventilation torn off in the bathroom. To add to that the hotel is under renovation (should’t they close for that?) and the whole building is wrapped in scaffold, so you feel very uncomfortable when the construction workers start to walk around your windows in the morning. Although we paid a premium price for the hotel through Universe Travel we got a worst hotel that we ever stayed at anywhere. Very bad experience. We would never stay in this place again, and strongly recommend not to book this hotel unless you like to spoil your vacation & overall experience in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Hotel - Clean but...”
Reviews.Author: LauraMG
Reviews.Content: We booked the Tre Stelle wanting a budget hotel that was close to the city centre...indeed this is what we got. The hotel is very close to Termini station which is convenient if arriving from Campiano airport on the Terrovision bus or if arriving by train. The hotel is part of a large building which actually contains other hotels such as the Hotel Dolomiti - a hotel which I didn't book because I had seen some disappointing reviews for it. Good points of the hotel include: Central location Cleanliness Friendly and helpful staff However, some bad points as well: The place needs some serious re-docration, there was plaster peeling of the walls in lots of places (although there were guys doing plastering whilst we were there!) Our room looked like something out of the 1970s - furniture, curtains, all bathroom furniture including a shower hose with no hook on the wall (annoying when washing your hair) Not enough blankets on the bed - we were cold but the receptionist did get us another blanket from one of the empty rooms The breakfast was just croissant with tea or coffee, however the waiter was really friendly every morning. We spoke to a lot of people whilst we were out in Rome though and it seems for our money, we didn't get a bad deal on the hotel. If you just want somewhere to just sleep and wash then Hotel Tre Stelle will be fine for you...oh and the lift is pretty scary!

Reviews.Title: “Did not like at all!”
Reviews.Author: leonzo
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the worst hotel I have ever stayed in in my life! We rented 2 rooms for 3 nights from December 30, 2006 until January 1, 2007. In the room my wife and I were assigned it smelled like a sewer or rotting garbage. The towels were very dull, dirty and dingy looking and the shower stall was so small I literally could not fit into it. The t.v. set had a 10 inch or smaller screen, and even though it was hooked up to a cable antenna most of the 10 channels it received were of very poor picture quality. When we complained about the smell the desk person gave us a can of air freshner. It helped a little. When we went to bed one of thebeds had broken springs to the point that I couldn't sleep in it. My wife traded beds with me and she made herself a sleeping bag like area out of the blankets and was able to sleep wrapped up for the 1st night. Between the smell and the bed we requested another room the next night and fortunately we were moved to another room. My kids room had roaches which they killed several. The room we were moved to had a roach crawling around in the desk drawer, little to no heat coming from the small radiator located next to the window that was blocked by the curtains so even if it came on you wouldn't feel it because the heat would all be behind the curtain. Since it never got really hot there was no need for constant air conditoning but the hotel has none. Our last night was very humid outside which made the room very stuffy so even in the winter the ability to have some a/c to help in situations like that is helpful. While I realize that we were staying in Rome during a holiday weekend there is a premium price to be paid, I strongly feel we paid a premium price for a lot less then premium sleeping quarters. I will never stay there or a similiar place again. I am not even sure I will ever let AAA book me again but that is a totally different story!

Reviews.Title: “A catalogue of catastrophes”
Reviews.Author: citygyal
Reviews.Content: A group of young ladies booked rooms at the Tre Stelle. It was one catastrophe after another from beginning to end! The night we arrived, we were shown room 156 which was very below standard. The blankets were old, had holes in them and were frayed at the edges. The towels were no different - they too were old as though they had been there for donkey's years! To our shock, horror and amazement a cockroach fell from a ledge in the bathroom into a bin! One of us bagged it and took it to show the receptionist who showed no alarm whatsovever! we told the receptionist that we refused to stay in the room. It took 7 viewings of different rooms of repeated mouldy shower screens, holes in towels and blankets, shower enclosures that wouldn't close (room 338) and exposed wires. We complained and said that the rooms were not like the ones shown on the hotel website and asked why can't we have one of those. After viewing rooms and pleading for the room shown on the Internet, we were finally given a room that resembled the rooms shown on the Internet. Why did they not give us this roon in the first place? Why did it take 3 hours of pleading adn viewing to get what was advertised? To add salt to injury, one of us was given a room with a toilet that didn't flush. Another had no running hot water! If you choose to stay at the hotel remember the following, the room shown on the hotel website are of the re-furbished rooms only and not the the dirty, dingy ones we were first shown. Also, be aware there is a bird flying loose in the breakfast area, take your own towels or buy them in Rome and leave them there! The worst thing is that we were tourists to Rome and felt we had to beg to get what we felt we had paid for at the Tre Stelle. I would rather sleep in the Termini than stay at the Tre Stelle. .

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a 3 day break booked to Rome, originally with the Hotel Margaret. However, the hotel was booked when we arrived and we were moved to the Hotel Tre Stelle. We were pleased that we were as it was much nicer. It is a 3 star (Rome standards not UK standards), basic but clean hotel with a nice bar/breakfast area. The breakfast was OK - a roll or pastry with the most fantastic coffee we had in Rome (and we had a lot)! It is in a good location (2 mins on foot from Termini) and therefore had great access to transport links. The rooms were basic, but sufficient. Accommodation is generally quite pricey in Rome and this represented good value. It is near a supermarket and cash points, and some great little cafe's.

Reviews.Title: “Traumatic experience with night receptionist”
Reviews.Author: withwings
Reviews.Content: After a sucessful stay at the Tre Stelle, we decided to book again. (see my companions review from our first experience; Aug 29) We shall never stay again. We were each given a room on different floors. The Night time receptionist became very suggestive towards me, asking if I was lonely and refusing to let me into the door leading to my floor, then he became very aggressive. Fortunately I had a mobile telephone and was able to contact my friend. Throughout the stay we felt very vulnerable and intimidated. I DO NOT ADVISE FEMALE TRAVELLERS TO STAY AT THIS HOTEL!!
